result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Todd Holeman

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

2:04 PM Defendant Steven Todd Holeman appeared by video.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Blake Gross appeared by video for Steven Todd Holeman.  Attorney has received information, waives reading, stands mute on all charges.  NG pleas entered.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:28 AM Prosecuting attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven Todd Holeman appeared by phone.  Attorney Blake Gross appeared by video for Steven Todd Holeman. Atty comments-- will waive prelim today. 11:36am Off the record. Back on the record 11:38am Ready to move forward, Ct finds know and vol waives right to prelim. Ct finds PC the def com a fel in Ashland Co & bound over for argnmt. State will be filing a info now, Atty would like argnment at a later date.
Arraignment scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
09:08 AM Defendant Steven Todd Holeman in court with attorney Blake Gross.  David V. Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. Atty comments- waives reading of the compl, asking for a prelim, will waive TL for a prelim. Ct finds the def know and vol waives TL for the prelim.
Def can appear by zoom by video or stipulation to identification.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.
PEtition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency
Adjourned initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:11 AM Defendant Steven Todd Holeman in court.  David V. Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. Def does not qualify for a PD atty, asking the Ct to apt an atty for him. Will not be hiring his own atty. The Def will need to file paperwork for Ct apt'd atty. Def will be here on Thursday.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

02:38 PM Defendant Steven Todd Holeman in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def now rec'd compl, advised of rights to an atty. Def would like an atty. Will try and hire his own atty. Asking for a 30 day adjment. State has no comment. IF the def is not able to hire his own atty by next court date he needs to contact PD  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Def to have NO Contact w/S.B.
Def not to be within 1 block of 607 17th Ave W. Ashland Wi.
